description.raw:
* Windows test

* Revert testing

* Style

* Spelling

* Param_TEST.cc: add links to sdformat issue

* Move functions that use TinyXML symbols to private headers

* Do not export symbols of functions in private headers

* parser_private.hh edited online with Bitbucket

* Do not install Converter.hh

* Added removal of TinyXML classes from public headers to ChangeLog

* Fix converter test, and updated migration guid

* markdown

* Remove extra include

* Close branch fix_tiny_includes

* Fix cmake warnings on Windows.

* Use whitespace trick in cmake vars.

* Remove blank line

* Close branch windows_tests

* Close branch fix_cmake_warnings

* Close branch sdf4_to_default

* fix coverity issues

* add error message in case pointer to XML node _key is NULL

* Added example

* Changelog

* Add 'examples' to the style checker and minor tweaks.

* Fix style checker in Xenial.

* add tag to allow for specification of initial joint position

* Close branch example

* Close branch style_xenial

* Close branch joint_position_initialization

* check if target exists before using it as dependency

* create schema target using latest version

* Close branch dirk-check-target

* Get improvement

* Added utility

* Tie test

* Close branch sdf4_get_improvement

* Remove sdf4 deprecations and bump to 5.0.0

* Require ignition-math3

* PIMPlize SDFImpl

* adddd

* ignore dll interface warning like in Console.hh

* Update changelog

* migration and changelog

* Close branch remove_deprecations

* Created branch sdf5

* Avoid the use of SDFImplPrivate.hh in the public header

* Close branch fix_sdfprivate_include_sdf5

* Close branch use_ignition3

* Added tag sdformat5_5.0.0 for changeset 6e4ddc6ad7be

* README edited online with Bitbucket

* README edited online with Bitbucket

* Moved readme

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* Remove an unnecessary check from Converter::Remove.

* Remove trailing whitespace in 1_5.convert

* Add in tests for the Converter::Remove method.

* Significantly simplify Converter::Remove.

    In particular, it has no reason to use boost:regex to split
    on ::.  It should act a lot more like Add, where it just
    takes a specific element or attribute to remove, and does
    just that.  As an added bonus, we also add the ability to
    remove attributes with this commit.

* Add in a test for Converter::Remove of attributes.

* Remove an unnecessary check.

* Be consistent with curly braces.

    Always put them after a statement that could be compound,
    even if it is not right now.  It reduces noise, and possibly
    bugs, in future patches.

* Add a test with an invalid move element

* Add a test for an invalid move prefix.

* Add in a test for Converter::Move with copy.

* Replace use of boost::algorithm::regex with std::regex.

* Add a test for converting old <gazebo> -> <sdf>

* Remove use of boost lexical_cast.

    We can just use the standard library stod instead.

* Fix style comments from review.

* Don't look for unnecessary boost libraries anymore.

    This includes iostreams and regex.  Also update the
    help text to only include the boost libraries we still
    require.

* Style fixup.

* Switch a couple of NULL to nullptr.

* Get rid of std::regex in split_double_colon.

    As pointed out by scpeters in review, on our oldest
    platforms std::regex doesn't work correctly.  Thus, we
    use std::basic_string functionality instead, which should
    still be O(n).  As a bonus, it is shorter code too!
description.html:
• Windows test

  • Revert testing

  • Style

  • Spelling

  • Param_TEST.cc: add links to sdformat issue

  • Move functions that use TinyXML symbols to private headers

  • Do not export symbols of functions in private headers

  • parser_private.hh edited online with Bitbucket

  • Do not install Converter.hh

  • Added removal of TinyXML classes from public headers to ChangeLog

  • Fix converter test, and updated migration guid

  • markdown

  • Remove extra include

  • Close branch fix_tiny_includes

  • Fix cmake warnings on Windows.

  • Use whitespace trick in cmake vars.

  • Remove blank line

  • Close branch windows_tests

  • Close branch fix_cmake_warnings

  • Close branch sdf4_to_default

  • fix coverity issues

  • add error message in case pointer to XML node _key is NULL

  • Added example

  • Changelog

  • Add 'examples' to the style checker and minor tweaks.

  • Fix style checker in Xenial.

  • add tag to allow for specification of initial joint position

  • Close branch example

  • Close branch style_xenial

  • Close branch joint_position_initialization

  • check if target exists before using it as dependency

  • create schema target using latest version

  • Close branch dirk-check-target

  • Get improvement

  • Added utility

  • Tie test

  • Close branch sdf4_get_improvement

  • Remove sdf4 deprecations and bump to 5.0.0

  • Require ignition-math3

  • PIMPlize SDFImpl

  • adddd

  • ignore dll interface warning like in Console.hh

  • Update changelog

  • migration and changelog

  • Close branch remove_deprecations

  • Created branch sdf5

  • Avoid the use of SDFImplPrivate.hh in the public header

  • Close branch fix_sdfprivate_include_sdf5

  • Close branch use_ignition3

  • Added tag sdformat5_5.0.0 for changeset 6e4ddc6ad7be

  • README edited online with Bitbucket

  • README edited online with Bitbucket

  • Moved readme

  • README.md edited online with Bitbucket

  • README.md edited online with Bitbucket

  • README.md edited online with Bitbucket

  • Remove an unnecessary check from Converter::Remove.

  • Remove trailing whitespace in 1_5.convert

  • Add in tests for the Converter::Remove method.

  • Significantly simplify Converter::Remove.

    In particular, it has no reason to use boost:regex to split on ::. It should act a lot more like Add, where it just takes a specific element or attribute to remove, and does just that. As an added bonus, we also add the ability to remove attributes with this commit.

  • Add in a test for Converter::Remove of attributes.

  • Remove an unnecessary check.

  • Be consistent with curly braces.

    Always put them after a statement that could be compound, even if it is not right now. It reduces noise, and possibly bugs, in future patches.

  • Add a test with an invalid move element

  • Add a test for an invalid move prefix.

  • Add in a test for Converter::Move with copy.

  • Replace use of boost::algorithm::regex with std::regex.

  • Add a test for converting old <gazebo> -> <sdf>

  • Remove use of boost lexical_cast.

    We can just use the standard library stod instead.

  • Fix style comments from review.

  • Don't look for unnecessary boost libraries anymore.

    This includes iostreams and regex. Also update the help text to only include the boost libraries we still require.

  • Style fixup.

  • Switch a couple of NULL to nullptr.

  • Get rid of std::regex in split_double_colon.

    As pointed out by scpeters in review, on our oldest platforms std::regex doesn't work correctly. Thus, we use std::basic_string functionality instead, which should still be O(n). As a bonus, it is shorter code too!

title.raw: Remove boost branch (test PR, not for merging)
title.html: Remove boost branch (test PR, not for merging)

description:
* Windows test

* Revert testing

* Style

* Param_TEST.cc: add links to sdformat issue

* Move functions that use TinyXML symbols to private headers

* Do not export symbols of functions in private headers

* parser_private.hh edited online with Bitbucket

* README edited online with Bitbucket

* README edited online with Bitbucket

* Moved readme

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* README.md edited online with Bitbucket

* Remove an unnecessary check from Converter::Remove.

* Remove trailing whitespace in 1_5.convert

* Add in tests for the Converter::Remove method.

* Significantly simplify Converter::Remove.

    In particular, it has no reason to use boost:regex to split
    on ::.  It should act a lot more like Add, where it just
    takes a specific element or attribute to remove, and does
    just that.  As an added bonus, we also add the ability to
    remove attributes with this commit.

* Add in a test for Converter::Remove of attributes.

* Remove an unnecessary check.

* Be consistent with curly braces.

    Always put them after a statement that could be compound,
    even if it is not right now.  It reduces noise, and possibly
    bugs, in future patches.

* Add a test with an invalid move element

* Add a test for an invalid move prefix.

* Add in a test for Converter::Move with copy.

* Replace use of boost::algorithm::regex with std::regex.

* Add a test for converting old <gazebo> -> <sdf>

* Remove use of boost lexical_cast.

    We can just use the standard library stod instead.

* Fix style comments from review.

* Don't look for unnecessary boost libraries anymore.

    This includes iostreams and regex.  Also update the
    help text to only include the boost libraries we still
    require.

* Style fixup.

* Switch a couple of NULL to nullptr.

* Get rid of std::regex in split_double_colon.

    As pointed out by scpeters in review, on our oldest
    platforms std::regex doesn't work correctly.  Thus, we
    use std::basic_string functionality instead, which should
    still be O(n).  As a bonus, it is shorter code too!

* Remove an unnecessary check from Converter::Remove.

* Remove trailing whitespace in 1_5.convert

* Add in tests for the Converter::Remove method.

* Significantly simplify Converter::Remove.

    In particular, it has no reason to use boost:regex to split
    on ::.  It should act a lot more like Add, where it just
    takes a specific element or attribute to remove, and does
    just that.  As an added bonus, we also add the ability to
    remove attributes with this commit.

* Add in a test for Converter::Remove of attributes.

* Remove an unnecessary check.

* Be consistent with curly braces.

    Always put them after a statement that could be compound,
    even if it is not right now.  It reduces noise, and possibly
    bugs, in future patches.

* Style fixup.

  • Remove an unnecessary check from Converter::Remove.

  • Remove trailing whitespace in 1_5.convert

  • Add in tests for the Converter::Remove method.

  • Significantly simplify Converter::Remove.

    In particular, it has no reason to use boost:regex to split on ::. It should act a lot more like Add, where it just takes a specific element or attribute to remove, and does just that. As an added bonus, we also add the ability to remove attributes with this commit.

  • Add in a test for Converter::Remove of attributes.

  • Remove an unnecessary check.

  • Be consistent with curly braces.

    Always put them after a statement that could be compound, even if it is not right now. It reduces noise, and possibly bugs, in future patches.

  • Add a test with an invalid move element

  • Add a test for an invalid move prefix.

  • Add in a test for Converter::Move with copy.

  • Replace use of boost::algorithm::regex with std::regex.

  • Add a test for converting old <gazebo> -> <sdf>

  • Remove use of boost lexical_cast.

    We can just use the standard library stod instead.

  • Fix style comments from review.

  • Don't look for unnecessary boost libraries anymore.

    This includes iostreams and regex. Also update the help text to only include the boost libraries we still require.

  • Style fixup.

  • Switch a couple of NULL to nullptr.

  • Get rid of std::regex in split_double_colon.

    As pointed out by scpeters in review, on our oldest platforms std::regex doesn't work correctly. Thus, we use std::basic_string functionality instead, which should still be O(n). As a bonus, it is shorter code too!
